description.plain:
Shawn Peter Raul Mendes (born August 8, 1998 in Toronto, Ontario) is a Canadian singer and songwriter. He spent his early days learning to play guitar by watching YouTube tutorial videos, when Shawn was younger he was judged for being so invested in watching youtube influencers. He started doing covers on youtube but then, gained millions of followers in a few months for singing on Vine in 2013, becoming the third most-followed artist on the platform in 2014. He was in magcon in 2014 with Jack Gillinsky, Nash Grier, Cameron Dallas, Matt Espinosa, and Jack Johnson.

He officially signed with Island Records in May 2014 and released his first single “Life of the Party” on June 26, 2014. His debut album Handwritten, which included hit single “Stitches”, reached the top 10 in the U.S. and Canada, and number one in the UK. He went to re-release that album under Handwritten Revisted with four new tracks, including collaboration with Fifth Harmony member Camila Cabello, “I Know What You Did Last Summer.”

His second studio album Illuminate delivered three hit singles: “Treat You Better”, “Mercy”, and “There’s Nothing Holdin' Me Back”. The latter single peaked in the Billboard Top 10 and also reached number one on the Mainstream Top 40 airplay chart. In August 2017, he became the first artist under 20 to have three number-one songs on the Billboard Adult Pop Songs chart.

On March 22, 2018, Mendes released “In My Blood,” the lead single from his eponymous third album, Shawn Mendes, which released on May 25, 2018. He also released the second single from the album, “Lost in Japan”, the following day on March 23.

On May 3, 2019, Mendes released “If I Can’t Have You,” which was the lead single from his highly anticipated fourth album. He teamed up with Camila Cabello to release their second single together, “Señorita”.

description.plain:
“There’s Nothing Holdin' Me Back” is about Shawn Mendes' ambiguous and manipulative relationship to a woman and his acceptance of the mental effects caused by her.

On April 17th, 2017, the Canadian singer-songwriter announced that he will be releasing this song as a new single on April 20, 2017.

This song keeps to the vibe of the Illuminate album, but it has a rougher and moodier feel to it.

description.plain:
On “In My Blood,” Shawn Mendes takes a heavier and more mature approach production-wise, while still sticking to his acoustic roots in the verses. The day before the release he tweeted a message to his fans saying:

This song is the closest song to my heart that I’ve ever written.

In an interview with Billboard, Mendes explained that the song is about his first experience with anxiety:

The concept of this song is about how it feels [when] you’re about to give up, and then you don’t. That’s the whole payoff in the chorus section…It’s not about when it happens. It’s kind of about something that I think everybody goes through and it’s something that I think people don’t talk about often, especially in music.

description.plain:
On “Lost In Japan,” Shawn Mendes demonstrates his commitment to a lover by expressing his desire to visit them on the other side of the world. The song was released a day after the single “In My Blood.”

While “In My Blood” incorporates a rock-arena sound, “Lost In Japan” showcases R&B-heavy beats.

The song’s artwork is an ode to Japan, depicting the country’s national flower, the Cherry blossom.

description.plain:
“Treat You Better” serves as the lead single for Shawn Mendes' second studio album. The single released on June 3, 2016. The song rocketed up the iTunes charts to number 3 within hours of release, in part, due to Shawn’s #BetteroniTunes drive, encouraging fans to buy it directly from the Apple service.

Lyrically, Mendes sings to his romantic interest, promising to be a better boyfriend than the one she currently has. There was some speculation that this song was about Camila Cabello, the Fifth Harmony member who was rumored to have been dating Mendes in 2016. Both of them, however, insist that they’re just friends.

In Seventeen, Mendes did talk about how he’s matured since his last album, referencing a past relationship:

I have songs about growing up, about ex-relationships—ex-relationship, I should say. I haven’t had relationships. A couple of songs about relationships with girls since fame.

This song’s instrumentation is heavy on guitar. Teddy Geiger and Scott Harris helped pen the lyrics (they were behind two of the major hits on Mendes' previous album Handwritten). Gieger contributed to production alongside Dan Romer, a veteran in the music industry who’s also worked with film, most notably scoring 2011’s Beasts of the Southern Wild.

description.plain:
“If I Can’t Have You” is the upbeat, The 1975-inspired track that marks the beginning of Shawn Mendes' fourth musical era after the May 2018 release of his third studio album, Shawn Mendes. The track marks his highest ranking career debut and first top 3 hit with an opening rank at #2 on Billboard’s Hot 100.

In an interview with SiriusXM Hits 1, Shawn summarized the track as

…an elevated version of what you know as Shawn Mendes Music.

In an interview with Beats 1, Shawn described “If I Can’t Have You” as a “confident pop record” and went on to say that

This is the one that consistently every time I play it for myself, or for friends and family, it has just given people ‘that’ smile.

Shortly after the song’s release, in an interview with Rolling Stone, Shawn revealed that he originally wrote the song with Dua Lipa in mind. In a later interview with New 102.7, he clarified that he’d never contacted Dua about the song, and that giving her the track was just an idea he had.

The song’s lyrics first appeared on Genius on April 26, 2019; the same day Shawn’s manager, Andrew Gertler, teased “some serious surprises” on his Instagram. Shawn first teased the song’s release on May 1, 2019 via his Twitter.

“If I Can’t Have You” and its accompanying music video were released at midnight on May 3, 2019. The song’s first live performance  was May 4th on Saturday Night Live, where Shawn starred as a musical guest.

In an interview with SiriusXM Hits 1, Shawn summarized the track as

…an elevated version of what you know as Shawn Mendes Music.

In an interview with Beats 1, Shawn described “If I Can’t Have You” as a “confident pop record” and went on to say that

This is the one that consistently every time I play it for myself, or for friends and family, it has just given people ‘that’ smile.

Shortly after the song’s release, in an interview with Rolling Stone, Shawn revealed that he originally wrote the song with Dua Lipa in mind. In a later interview with New 102.7, he clarified that he’d never contacted Dua about the song, and that giving her the track was just an idea he had.

The song’s lyrics first appeared on Genius on April 26, 2019; the same day Shawn’s manager, Andrew Gertler, teased “some serious surprises” on his Instagram. Shawn first teased the song’s release on May 1, 2019 via his Twitter.

“If I Can’t Have You” and its accompanying music video were released at midnight on May 3, 2019. The song’s first live performance  was May 4th on Saturday Night Live, where Shawn starred as a musical guest.

description.plain:
“Mercy” is a brooding piano ballad that focuses on heartbreak. It serves as the third single from Shawn Mendes' second studio album Illuminate.

During the week leading up to the release, Shawn released a snippet of the song every day, similar to the strategy he used for Illuminate’s lead single “Treat You Better.”

The “Mercy” music video shows Shawn trying not to figuratively drown in his emotions and literally drown underwater in a sinking car.

description.plain:
“Stitches” is the sixth single of singer-songwriter Shawn Mendes’s debut album, Handwritten.

“Stitches” shares some similarities with “Love the Way You Lie”—both are about loving someone so much you can’t live without them, despite how much they hurt you.

description.plain:
“Youth” is the third single off of Shawn Mendes' self-titled album, and his first collaboration with breakout R&B sensation Khalid. In an interview, Shawn spoke about the importance of the song and its lyrics to him:

It’s the most important song on the album… I wanted to write something but it had to be about the feeling for us as a generation when [a tragedy] happens. So I wrote a song about our youth, a feeling that can’t be taken away from us.

The song alludes to multiple terrorist attacks that occurred mid-2017 in the UK, particularly the explosion in Ariana Grande’s concert and the attack on London Bridge. The attacks caused great suffering and loss of life and left the youth of the nation in an insecure and fearful situation. Here, Shawn stand up against this.

description.plain:
Co-written by Ed Sheeran, “Fallin' All In You” is a ballad that sees Shawn describing what it’s like to inadvertently fall in love with someone.

In an interview with Zane Lowe, Shawn said this song was the first one he considered for Shawn Mendes the album. In the interview he said:

He sent me the hook. And it was with falsetto, right? This big falsetto hook. And I remember I looked at the emails and I texted back and I go “Hey dude I love this song I don’t- I can’t sing falsetto so, I’m not going to be able to do it”. And he goes, “Yeah you will. Just wait, you’ll be able to do it.” And then you know, I tried a bunch of times and it wasn’t until like four months later where I’m like “Oh yeah, this amazing song that I can sing.”

description.plain:
“Where Were You in the Morning?” is the fourth single from Shawn Mendes' self-titled third studio album.

Shawn teased this song months before the album release after sharing a snippet on his Snapchat and Instagram story. He says it’s about a one night stand that may be based on his real life experiences.

description.plain:
“Nervous” is the fifth promotional single from Shawn Mendes' self-titled third studio album.

Shawn recruits “Issues” crooner Julia Michaels to co-pen an anthem about the butterflies an individual feels when they are around their crush.

A black and white vertical video for “Nervous” was released the same day as the album, and a full color official version was released on June 11, 2018. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DGzy8FE1Rhk

description.plain:
“Imagination” is the second bonus track off of Mendes' platinum-selling debut studio album Handwritten. The song clocks in at 3 minutes 38 seconds and follows many of the familiar love-pop tropes of unrequited love that Shawn Mendes is known for.

The official audio on YouTube, as of November 2017, has over 40 million views.

description.plain:
“Life of the Party” is YouTube sensation Shawn Mendes' first original single. Shawn is well known for his work with other artists but according to an interview with MTV he always found it “weird” covering other people’s music.

Because of this, on June 25th 2014, Shawn released this single, a song with an often minimal piano instrumental, innocently romantic lyrics, and a gracefully rich voice. Within hours, the song reached #1 on iTunes:

https://twitter.com/ShawnMendes/status/482023751786053632

description.plain:
“Perfectly Wrong” is the penultimate track from Shawn Mendes' self-titled studio album.

The song describes Shawn’s seemingly ill-fated relationship, and appears to have gained inspiration from William Shakespeare’s Romeo and Juliet whose protagonists are also characterized as being star-crossed lovers.

description.plain:
In “Why”, Shawn Mendes sings about an unspoken attraction between him and another girl; Both of them are attracted to each other but neither of them admits it. In the song, Shawn expresses his frustration over their silence and asks why neither of them breaks the tension and admit how they feel about each other.

Written over soft keys with a guitar in the background, the song follows a smooth pattern, reminiscent of R&B music. Shawn uses a vocoder towards the end of the song, which splits his voice into vocal chords to convey a beautiful but yet sad and vulnerable sound, which fits into the context of the song.

At the time of it’s release, the song was widely speculated to be about Camila Cabello with whom Shawn Mendes has had a burgeoning friendship with since 2015. The two have collaborated on music in the past, with Camila featured on “I Know What You Did Last Summer”. Rumors of the two dating are almost as old as their friendship itself. They both met opening for Austin Mahone at his concert in 2014 and became friends during Taylor Swift’s 1989 Tour in 2015. Both of them have repeatedly denied they were involved.

On December 21st, 2019 during a fan Q&A Shawn Mendes, confirmed this song was indeed written about Camila, whom he has since begun dating earlier that year. When a fan asked him Why did it took so long to tell Camila he was in love with her,
his response was:

I wrote the song “Why”. I was gonna send it to her and I was with Scott and Teddy in the studio. I was gonna send it to her but they told me to wait. I was gonna go see her in New York or something I was gonna tell her in person… "

“Like To Be You” is the most anticipated collaboration of Mendes' self-titled album, alongside “Youth.” It is Mendes' first collaboration with Julia Michaels.

The track is a “conversational" song, where the two singers go back and forth with each other throughout the lyrics.

description.plain:
“Because I Had You” is the 9th track from Shawn Mendes' self-titled album & he said in an interview with Zane Low that it’s the last song that he wrote for it. Musically, it’s a ballad, with soft electric guitar notes and one of the most simple tracks he wrote.

In this song, Mendes talks about this one girl that he can’t seem to get over. He thinks he won’t be able to give love to anyone else because he used to have her. He keeps reminiscising to all the things they lived together.

description.plain: Inspired by The Plain White T’s hit single Hey There Delilah, sixteen-year-old singer, songwriter, and guitarist Shawn Mendes' single “Never Be Alone” is the fifth single released off of his debut album Handwritten. Being a fiction-based lyrical composition for Mendes, the song is notable exemplary of the young Canadian’s reasoning for his album’s title.

description.plain:
When You’re Ready is the last song on Shawn’s self-titled album.

This song is essentially a mellow, slightly drunk, love letter, where Shawn is promising somebody he will patiently wait until they feel ready to be together – if after ten years they fail to find someone else.

It is directed at somebody of his past, somebody familiar, somebody he knows inside out and feels a connection to he has yet to experience with anyone else.

The confessional-style of the lyrics, the recognizable Mendes acoustic elements and the longevity of his promise, makes this song an incredibly timeless end to his third studio album.

description.plain:
In “Roses”, Shawn is questioning his love for a girl and his fear of rejection. The girl, according to the song lyrics, already has a significant other but may still be interested.

He is sure his love for her is greater than her current significant other, so he is giving her this “rose”, which is a chance for their love to blossom and flourish into something beautiful, like a rose.

description.plain:
On the tenth track, “Queen” from his self-titled album, Shawn Mendes talks about someone who is stuck-up and believes they have more power over everyone else, hence making her the “queen.”

When asked about the song from an article by Entertainment Weekly, Shawn Mendes said:

[…] It’s not about somebody in particular. I just hate people who think they’re better than other people. There’s no reason to. It just bugs me, man. My least favorite trait in somebody is when you can feel them acting like they’re more important than you, and I just had to write a song about it. I thought the best way to talk about it was to be like, ‘You’re not the queen of a country.’

description.plain:
In “Particular Taste” Shawn talks about a woman who isn’t interested in a relationship and only wants to have some fun. The woman is described as having an eccentric personality and a bit of a player.

Musically, its a dance-pop and synth-pop song backed by light percussion instruments, finger snaps, hand claps, and guitar riffs.

description.plain: As one of the standouts on the album Handwritten, “Aftertaste” depicts Shawn doing a topic change. While most of Shawn’s biggest hits involve him being melancholy or even distraught over a breakup, he seems to actually have a sense of triumph in this song, by claiming that no one will replace him. Another strong side of him is shown by him agreeing to give his ex one last kiss, if only so that she will remember how good he was for her.

description.plain:
According to an interview with Billboard, Mendes' song “Patience” is about a girl older than him whom he hooked up with, but the next day she was so scared because of how young he was. “I have a sore spot for older people who are weird around younger people,” said Mendes.

“Patience” was released along with his sophomore album, Illuminate, on 23rd September.

description.plain: “Understand” is about Shawn being scared about changing because he’s scared about he maybe become someone completely different to who he is now. He’s scared of going from the super nice guy that he is now, to the complete opposite, but then he realizes that change isn’t something to be afraid about.

description.plain:
‘Lights On’ is the eighth song on his second album ‘Illuminate’ released in late 2016.
The song is about how he loves the girl for her personality, as well as her body.
He will love her all day and all night long.

description.plain:
“Something Big” is a single from Vine-star Shawn Mendes. It’s acoustic dance music, similar to Ed Sheeran’s “Sing”, except with some horns.

For the single’s reveal, he got fans to trend a hashtag for a Twitter/Instagrams campaign, which climaxed with fans from various cities taking group photos in order to drop the song.

description.plain:
The second track off of Canadian pop artist Shawn Mendes' self-titled EP.

The track, a pop “hater-anthem”, shows Mendes will stop at nothing achieve his dreams. People can say what they want, but Mendes will prove them wrong, as they place no restrictions on him.

description.plain:
“Air” is the ninth track off Shawn Mendes' debut album. It marks the first collaboration between Mendes and Norwegian singer/songwriter Astrid S.

In a 2016 interview with andPOP, Astrid said:

They reached out to me and said this up-and-coming artist, Shawn Mendes, was going to have an album and if I wanted to be on the album. So I went to a studio in Oslo and recorded the vocals and they were really happy

description.plain:
Being the eighth song released off of his debut album Handwritten, singer-songwriter, and sixteen-year-old world-renown social media star Shawn Mendes astonishes his listeners once again with his phenomenal musical compositions. It is suggested that “Kid In Love” is supposed to be the ballad for those lost, youthful souls that would do anything for their maybe not-so-significant other, but would still perform for their every whim and need because they’re hopelessly head over heels infatuated with that special someone. The album is set to be released on 14 April 2015 at midnight, and can be pre-ordered here via iTunes, Amazon, and here for a physical signed deluxe book edition.
https://vine.co/v/Ol9gX9HLQJX

description.plain:
“Act Like You Love Me” is the 14th track on Shawn Mendes’ 2nd released album , “Handwritten: Revisited”. The song explores the need of closure at the end of a relationship. Mendes explains his feelings on the last night he is seeing his significant other before they leave. Mendes begs them to stay longer although they cannot. He needs them to act like they love him so that he can get closure from the relationship to move on.

“Handwritten: Revisited” was released on 14 April 2015. The album included 6 of the singles from his first album “Handwritten”, 5 live performances at the Greek Theatre of other songs from said album, and 5 new songs.

description.plain:
This song is about song is about how it feels when one is about to give up, and then doesn’t, according to Shawn Mendes in a 2018  interview to Billboard.

Released as an official song to support Portugal’s Soccer Team at the 2018 World Cup which started the day after Mendes released this version of the song. It’s video shows several Portuguese players and shots of Mendes performing as well as people singing along wearing Portugal jerseys.

Mendes' father is Portuguese and he showed his support for Portugal in the past Euro 2016 when he tweeted to show his support to the country.

https://twitter.com/shawnmendes/status/752181938035666944

description.plain: This song is a really good representation of what teenage years look like for guys, they think that they are indestructible and that they are exempt from all the rules of life, but as they grow up and mature, they realize that they are in no way indestructible or exempt from the rules of life. Just as Mendes realizes that he is wrong about what he thought before.

description.plain: On October 11, 2018, Shawn Mendes dropped a cover of Queen’s “Under Pressure” featuring his trans friend and producer Teddy Geiger. The track is to feature in the 2018 film “Bohemian Rhapsody”, starring Rami Malek as Freddie Mercury. Mercury passed away from AIDS related complications in 1991. It’s revenue will “benefit the Mercury Phoenix Trust in the fight against HIV / AIDS”. The organization was founded by  the surviving members of Queen in April 1992.

description.plain:
‘Lost" is a song about how people have lost their connection to the real world, instead living for the world on our phones and computers. Shawn is describing society today, how this generation is consumed by technology and society’s pressure to satisfy our virtual profiles, and as a consequence missing out on moments and real relationships in reality.

The song is the sixteenth track off Mendes' debut album Handwritten.

songs.embed_content: Read “Biography” by Shawn Mendes on Genius
songs.full_title: Biography by Shawn Mendes
songs.title: Biography

annotatable.link_title: Biography by Shawn Mendes
annotatable.title: Biography

songs.lyrics:
Shawn Peter Raul Mendes (born August 8, 1998) is a Canadian singer. He attracted a following in 2013, when he began posting song covers on the popular video sharing application Vine. The following year, he caught the attention of artist manager Andrew Gertler & Island Records A&R Ziggy Chareton which led to him signing a deal with the record label.
Mendes went on to release his debut single "Life of the Party", which become successful in his native Canada as well as internationally. Following the release of Life of the Party, he has released both an EP and a studio album, and has headlined a successful solo tour.
Mendes was born in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and was raised in Pickering, a suburb of the city. He is the son of Karen, a real estate agent, and Manuel Mendes, a businessman. His father is of Portuguese descent (from a family from Lagos), while his mother is English. He first started posting cover videos on the popular social video app Vine in 2013 and picked up millions of views and followers in a matter of months, becoming well known for his six-second snippets of renditions of many popular songs. Artist manager Andrew Gertler discovered Mendes online in January 2014, bringing him to Island Records where he eventually signed and released his first single "Life of the Party" in June 2014. He is the youngest artist to debut in the top 25 with a debut song on the Billboard Hot 100, making to number 24 for the week ending July 12, 2014 at 15 years, 11 months and 4 days of age.
Prior to his signing, Mendes toured as a member of the MagCon Tour alongside other young artists and social media sensations such as Nash Grier, Cameron Dallas, Jack & Jack, and more. Mendes was also on a nationwide tour with Austin Mahone as an opening act and released his debut major label EP in July, with a debut album due out later in 2014. He won the Teen Choice award in 2014 for Webstar in Music.

description.plain: On September 10, 2016, Shawn performed live at Madison Square Garden. Since it was so special and such a milestone in his career, he recorded his performances and released a whole album of live versions of his songs, “Bad Reputation” included.

songs.lyrics:
I've heard there was a secret chord

Her beauty

Hallelujah, Hallelujah

description.plain:
An unreleased/leaked song that first surfaced on leakth.is on September 4, 2020.

An 8 second snippet of this song was posted. The lyrics found on this page are all that can be identified in the short clip.

It is uncertain as to when this song was recorded, but going off of vocal maturity and the direction the music seems to be taking, it would be safe to assume that it was sometime after his world tour had come to a close.

The chances of this song being released officially in his upcoming project (SM4) are slim to none, primarily due to it having been leaked. In the past, leaked Shawn Mendes songs tend to be ones that are produced but do not make the final album cut and are not appropriate as singles.

description.plain: “Señorita (Solo Version)” is a song created by a fan through the ArianaGrande Vocals YouTube channel, taking only Shawn’s vocals from the smash-hit “Señorita” but without Camila. Besides this one, the channel also created the version without Shawn only with the Camila’s vocals.

description.plain: Shawn Mendes is a beautiful singer-songwriter, productor and model, with tattoos related to his life. Full name, Shawn Peter Raul Mendes. Most of his tattoos are related to his passion for music and also to his personal life and family. Two months before turning 18, on 2016, Shawn got his first tattoo, the “double guitar” that has been seen on most occasions, since he has it on his right arm.
